comment_0: According to Frank Sinatra, this is the best love song ever written.  I tend to like George's love songs better than the Lennon/McCartney love songs just because they're much deeper, sweeter, and more sincere.  The video had Ringo & Maureen, Paul & Linda, John & Yoko, and (of course) George & Patti.  Although, George and Patti latter divorced, this song is still one of the most sincere and sweet love songs I've ever heard.
comment_1:
My interpretation:
Boy meets girl
She is the most beautiful (inside and out) he's ever come across
So boy is going to be honest with the girl.
Boy can't promise forever, b/c he can't predict the future
But boy would love to promise forever, b/c girl knows everything 
Boy is thinking and compliments him perfectly.
Girl does for and teaches boy things he's always dreamed of
Boy cannot pin one thing and physical beauty has little to do
with his awe of said girl.

I about fell off my desk chair when someone sent me this song this past November.

Everyone is entitled to their own opinions, go forth and share!
comment_2: It seems to me that Patti Boyd must have been a very special woman. Not only was this song written about her, but so was "Layla" - two of the greatest songs of all time.
comment_3:
Yes George did write a few great songs, but how can you say hes better than John one of the ALL TIME greatest. George was better than Paul though. Pauls songs are only good for hearing not listening too.
Anyhow, yes I do remember George sayig this song was not about Patti, but maybe he was bitter when he said that.
comment_4: Someone commented that this song is based on a James Brown song, which is wrong.  It's based on the James Taylor song, "Something In The Way She Moves", which was released in 1968 by Apple Records.  George and Paul both worked on James Taylor's album with him, and George used the first line (and title) of James's song as a sort of temporary first line to start writing a song, but ended up keeping it.
comment_6:
I believe this song was a message for his friend E.Clapton:

"I don't want to leave her now,
You know I believe and how."
and also:
"Something in her style that shows me.
I don't want to leave her now,
You know I believe and how."

Until this part, GH was speaking about her, 
but now he turns to Clapton
as he changes "She/her"(Pattie)for "You" (E.Clapton): 

You're asking me: Will my love grow ?
I don't know, I don't know.
You stick around, now: it may show!
...I don't know, I don't know. (this three really emphasized
and I would say angry or at least annoyed! Just hear him again.
It seems to me He`s telling him: "I cannot agree on your taking her with you"
(in fact some time later Clapton came to GH saying he wanted to take Pattie
with him and GH said some kind of: "You want her; OK, just take her with you")
But at that time he still wanted to keep her and wrote his final message to
his friend E. Clapton:

"Something in the things she shows me.
I don't want to leave her now, 
You know I believe and how."
comment_7: What would say if I told you that the "She" that Georgie wrote about was none other than Mother Nature...it was the ultimate eternal Love song.
comment_8: Even though Sinatra said it was the best love song, he never gave George the credit. He always refered to it as a Lennon/McCartney song. George had a good reason to write this song too....Pattie was hot!!
comment_9: I really can't say anything more except that George Harrison (in my humble opinion) was by far the best Beatle.  If it wasn't for him, they never would've experimented with drugs and they never would've left their bubble gum pop era.  Not that there's anything wrong with their earlier work... It's just their later songs had SO much more meaning.  That's just my opinion, I could be wrong.
comment_10:
This song is one of the greatest songs written, for obvious reasons, and was covered by over 100 artists!
Don't think you'll find many other songs that have been recorded that many times! This has got to be George's finest song as a beatle!
comment_11: George wasn't the one that got The Beatles into drugs, but nevertheless this is an amazing love song.
comment_12: george was the quiet one while the beatles were the trendy mop top pop group. why? because he didn't fit in or like it. he was the one that first wrote the beatles songs that meant something. before them they were all about love and just the music, after they became songs that had meaning. they all were great songwriters and i dont' think any one of them is better than the other... they rank all tied for 2nd behind bob dylan.

comment_41: Actually this WAS NOT written about Pattie.... George wasn't thinking of her when he wrote this but was rather trying to imitate Ray Charles' style. Pattie and George were about to break up at this point in their relationship, so why would he write it for his soon to be ex-wife?

Idiots...this was NOT ABOUT PATTIE! and nor was patti special. she was trampy and disrespectful towards george. she was so trampy that she was okay with george going off with other women. the other wives were so much better, especially olivia harrison. and btw

PC: You're also performing "Something" on the live album. Now, you wrote that about Patti, is that right? 
GH: We'll no, I didn't, I just wrote it and then somebody put together a video and what they did, was they went out and got some footage of me and Patti, Paul and Linda, Ringo and Maureen, it was at that time, and John and Yoko and they just made up a little video to go with it, so then everybody presumed I wrote it about Patti, but actually when I wrote it I was thinking of Ray Charles.

comment_55: This song was nothing about pattie. In fact, many of you may know that george harrison believed in hinduism. The inspiration behind this song was that hindu god named Kristna. This was the greatest of god at that time, and was know as the god of love and all that was attractive. Though george really didnt mind people thinking of it about pattie, because he believed that individual love was a part of universal love. which is basically all the same. hope that answers anybodies questions.

comment_59: Something is clearly about a man looking upon his recently quickening lover, the something that he sees in this woman is a beauty more powerful than her physical attraction as she carries the lover of her lover, which is the child that is slowly blossoming and growing. A man's love never looks more beautiful than when he is watching his lover who is carrying his child. Of course the man can not place it and can only interpret this beatuy and love they are viewing as something. The greatest joy a couple can experience is of course a child. Anyhow the lines, "youre asking me will my love grow" well obviously the child is growing in the wombs confines, "you stick around and it might show," well, the stick is obviously phallic and the "stick around" also means, if you wait nine monrths, the baby might show, and "show" is obviously a reference to the saying a woman is showing when she gets the pregger bump, anyways, this is the meaning that works for me, everyone is entitled to their own, it makes the song that much more beautiful, so try it sometime and think about it this way. Give Peace a Chance.

comment_67: Duuuuuuuuude, Bob Dylan is the most over-rated songwriter ever! Yes, he is good: I will allow you your moment. And it is irrelevant as to whether he can sing or play (which, after 40 years, he can't). He is a good songwriter. And I stress good. He is by no means ahead of the Beatles, nor is he ahead of Leonard Cohen, Paul Simon, Syd Barrett, Roger Waters, Lou Reed, Jerry Cantrell, Jeff Buckely, and anyone else you can name, You have the same syndrome Nirvana fans have when they say Kurt Cobain was a genius. The guy wrote good songs, but is not the genius everyone makes him out to be. He was surrounded by far superior contemporaries, so get over it! DYLAN WAS (AND IS) AVERAGE IN COMPARISON TO THE ARTISTS YOU THINK HE IS SUPERIOR TO! You have ears, don't just hear, LISTEN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!1
